content:
fitzgen unlabeled issue #1709:

E.g. it may make sense for the cg_clif (the cranelift-based backend for rustc) to have its own peephole optimizations pass that contains optimizations specific to code generated by cg_clif.

akirilov-arm commented on issue #1709:

@fitzgen Since peepmatic has been removed in #3543, is this issue still relevant?

fitzgen commented on issue #1709:

I think it may make sense to allow registering custom passes at some time in the future, but I don't think this issue is really the way to track/discuss that.

fitzgen closed issue #1709:

E.g. it may make sense for the cg_clif (the cranelift-based backend for rustc) to have its own peephole optimizations pass that contains optimizations specific to code generated by cg_clif.
